subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Cost of Extreme Weather
description: A quick, practical guide to The Cost of Extreme Weather.

hook.text: In 2023, the world experienced 28 weather disasters that each caused over $1 billion in damage.

buildup.text: The economic cost of extreme weather has grown fivefold since the 1980s.

discovery.text: Part of this is more people and wealth in harm's way. But the weather itself is getting worse.

twist.text: Insurance companies are retreating from high-risk areas, leaving millions without coverage.

climax.text: Developing nations suffer the greatest losses relative to their economies â€” and have the least insurance.

punchline.text: Extreme weather has a price tag. And the bill is growing every year.

quiz.question: How has the economic cost of extreme weather changed since the 1980s?
